messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom]  books on males & puberty
messages.msgSnippet: ) Any personal recommendations/favorites would be appreciated. Thanks, This recommendation is tangential,
messages.messageBody:
<<(...and for a Mom who has never been a 11yob!! <g>) Any personal
recommendations/favorites would be appreciated.
Thanks,>>


This recommendation is tangential, but I think it's valuable for understanding men/boys. I LOVE "Iron John" by Robert Bly. The process of migrating from Mom's world to Dad's is different for boys. Girls don't have to migrate, eh. The process has been ridiculed in the pop press as naked men dancing in woods to drums. But it's "more" than that.

My (male) thots

Tim T



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
